articles.title: EXCLUSIVE Exxon Mobil launches sale of U.S. shale gas properties -marketing document
articles.summary: Exxon Mobil is selling shale gas properties spanning 27,000 acres in Ohio's Appalachian basin, including 61 wells that produced approximately 81 million cubic feet per day of natural gas last year. This divestment is part of an ongoing effort to sell U.S. assets and could value the properties at around $200 million. The company is focusing its development on brighter prospects in Guyana, offshore Brazil, and Texas's Permian Basin.

articles.title: Beyond Local: Imperial Oil continues to innovate bitumen extraction while reducing environmental impact
articles.summary: Imperial Oil is advancing its bitumen extraction methods at its Cold Lake Operations to improve environmental performance. The company is implementing technologies like LASER and SA-SAGD to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and water usage, with the first phase of the SA-SAGD expansion project expected to produce 15,000 barrels per day by 2023. These innovations aim to increase efficiency and reduce the environmental impact of heavy oil recovery.

articles.title: Exxon plans to shut Baytown, Texas, crude unit by late next week -sources
articles.summary: Exxon Mobil Corp plans to shut down the 135,000-bpd Pipestill-7 crude distillation unit (CDU) at its Baytown, Texas refinery by late next week for a planned overhaul. This comes as the refinery, Exxon's largest in the U.S., continues to operate at reduced levels following a December 23 explosion.

articles.title: W&T Offshore expands in Gulf of Mexico with $47M acquisition
articles.summary: W&T Offshore is expanding its operations in the Gulf of Mexico through a new $47 million acquisition. CEO Tracy Krohn stated that the current environment for acquisitions in the Gulf remains favorable. This move highlights the company's continued investment and growth strategy in the region.

articles.title: AT&T Shares Deserve a Return Call
articles.summary: AT&T is considered significantly undervalued despite an expected dividend cut, offering an attractive yield after refocusing on its core communications business. The planned spin-off of WarnerMedia into Warner Bros. Discovery provides shareholders with shares in a new media company while allowing AT&T to invest heavily in its wireless and fixed-line networks. Investors relying on the current dividend may be disappointed, but the strategic shifts position the company for future growth and a competitive dividend yield even post-cut.

articles.title: Exxon, Imperial Oil to market up to $1 billion in Canadian assets
articles.summary: Exxon Mobil and its affiliate Imperial Oil Ltd are planning to sell shale oil and gas properties in Western Canada, which could fetch between $500 million and $1 billion. This divestiture would make oil sands their largest Canadian onshore production business and is part of a broader effort by Exxon to sell smaller operations to pay down debt. XTO Energy Canada, jointly owned by Exxon and Imperial Oil, currently pumps about 9,000 barrels of liquids and 140 million cubic feet of natural gas per day in Canada.

articles.title: Commodities Notched Their Best Year Since 2009, Despite Precious Metals Weakness
articles.summary: Commodities experienced their best year since 2009, with the Bloomberg Commodity Spot Index gaining 27% in 2021, driven largely by energy prices. Precious metals, however, were the worst-performing category, with gold down 3.6% blamed on expectations of the Federal Reserve raising interest rates. The article highlights the resurgence of fossil fuels due to increased demand and discusses various market trends across emerging markets, energy, and digital currencies.

articles.title: Iraq to acquire Exxon Mobil's stake in West Qurna oilfield -minister
articles.summary: The Iraqi government has approved the Iraqi National Oil Company's acquisition of Exxon Mobil Corp's stake in the West Qurna 1 oilfield. This decision follows Exxon's reported intention to sell its 32.7% stake for $350 million. The West Qurna 1 field is a significant asset in southern Iraq, boasting over 20 billion barrels of recoverable reserves.

articles.title: DI People: JCPenney, 7-Eleven, Recode Therapeutics, Hawkeye, PCCI, and Others Make Moves
articles.summary: This article details numerous executive appointments and promotions across various companies in North Texas, including JCPenney, 7-Eleven, Recode Therapeutics, Hawkeye, and PwC. Key moves include new CEOs for Hawkeye, Harver, and Recode Therapeutics, and significant leadership changes in e-commerce, technology, and operations at other notable firms, reflecting a dynamic period of innovation and growth in the region.

articles.title: Insight: Harmful soot unchecked as Big Oil battles EPA over testing
articles.summary: A deadly form of soot pollution from U.S. refineries, known as condensable fine particulate matter, has gone unregulated for decades due to a dispute between the U.S. oil industry and federal environmental officials over measurement methods. This delay has led to significant unchecked emissions, with regional regulators in California attempting to crack down, sparking litigation from oil refiners like Chevron Corp and PBF Energy Inc. The EPA acknowledges issues with its current testing method but continues research, while environmental scientists warn against further delays in regulation.

articles.title: 3 ConocoPhillips Trades As Energy Prices Rise And Stock Sees Multi-Year Highs
articles.summary: ConocoPhillips (NYSE: COP) shares have surged by more than 90% since early 2021, fueled by rising energy prices and optimistic OPEC+ announcements. The article details potential investment strategies for COP, including buying dips, considering energy ETFs, or utilizing cash-secured put options for those anticipating continued highs. Analysts generally rate COP as "outperform" with a significant upside, despite potential short-term volatility around upcoming earnings and OPEC+ meetings.
